thread.title: National Association of Professional Women Inducts Mary Tufft, CSM, CSPO, Software Engineer at Honeywell, Into its VIP Woman of the Year Circle
thread.title_full: National Association of Professional Women Inducts Mary Tufft, CSM, CSPO, Software Engineer at Honeywell, Into its VIP Woman of the Year Circle - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: National Association of Professional Women Inducts Mary Tufft, CSM, CSPO, Software Engineer at Honeywell, Into its VIP Woman of the Year Circle
text:
Mary Tufft selected for her outstanding leadership and commitment within her profession.
Colorado Springs, CO (PRWEB) September 22, 2015
The National Association of Professional Women (NAPW) honors Mary Tufft as a 2015-2016 inductee into its VIP Woman of the Year Circle. She is recognized with this prestigious distinction for leadership in software engineering. NAPW is the nation’s leading networking organization exclusively for professional women, boasting more than 775,000 members and over 200 operating Local Chapters.
“I’m pleased to honor Mary with this prestigious award,” said NAPW President Star Jones. “Her success in the software engineering field is sure to inspire young girls and women to choose this career path.”
In July 2010, Ms. Tufft took on the role of Software Engineer at Honeywell, a company specializing in a variety of commercial and consumer projects, engineering services and aerospace technology. Since then, she has established a company-wide reputation for her vast knowledge in software engineering, Agile methodologies, configuration management, testing, requirements analysis and systems engineering.
Prior to her successful career at Honeywell, Ms. Tufft enjoyed 11 rewarding years as a Software Test Engineer for L-3 Communications, a contractor in aerospace systems and national security solutions. She is actively involved in many activities that enrich her civic connections to the community and is an avid supporter of charitable organizations such as the American Cancer Society and the local hospice.
The unwavering dedication and work ethic demonstrated by Ms. Tufft in her current position at Honeywell fully utilizes the dedication and aspirations for success that have earned her this recognition from the National Association of Professional Women, honoring her as an inspiration and a leader in her industry.
Awards & Accomplishments: Master’s, Colorado Technical University, Computer Science with an emphasis on Software Engineering
LinkedIn
About NAPW
NAPW’s mission is to provide an exclusive, highly advanced networking forum to successful women executives, professionals and entrepreneurs where they can aspire, connect and achieve. Through innovative resources, unique tools and progressive benefits, professional women interact, exchange ideas, advance their knowledge and empower each other.
